newsitem.title: UK: UK retail prices up yr/yr 2.7 pct in Nov.
newsitem.headline: UK retail prices up yr/yr 2.7 pct in Nov.

text.p: The Office for National Statistics released the following retail price indices for November:
RETAIL PRICES INDEX NOV OCT NOV 95
Mthly RPI pct change 0.1 UNCH UNCH
Mth pct change ex MIPs, tax 0.1 UNCH UNCH
COMPONENT DETAILS OF THE ALL-ITEMS INDEX (PCT CHANGES) -
NOTE - Consensus forecast was RPI up 0.1 pct MM,+2.7 pct YY, RPIX +3.3 pct YY, RPIY +3.0 pct YY.

The ONS said there were upward effects on the 12-month rate from motoring costs, clothing and footwear prices and leisure goods' prices. These effects were largely offset by downward pressure from food prices, especially those for non-seasonal food and from costs for fuel and light.
The 1.1 percent gain in clothing and footwear prices was the highest November rise for more than 20 years, the ONS said.
The main upward effect for clothing and footwear prices came from women's outerwear where prices rose more steeply than last November.
The tax and prices index rose 0.1 percent in November and 1.3 percent year-on-year with the index at 143.1.
The ONS said the budget effects are likely to reduce December's year-on-year RPI by about 0.03 percentage points, the ONS said.
Seasonal food prices generally rise in December, the ONS said. Non-seasonal food prices are likely to include rises in milk prices in December.
Alcoholic drinks are likely to be depressed by pre-Christmas price discounting.
On housing, the ONS noted a major lender had recently raised mortgage rates but said rate rises by other lenders will not feed into the index until January.
